bug.author: lanya16
bug.description:
Short summary about the issue/question: Brief what process you are following: How to reproduce it: I create local docker repoistry used by harbor, After deploy openpai , I try submit a example job, it executed failedã€‚ <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22021811/61342307-6119c280-a87c-11e9-8657-f228bd153d4e.png></denchmark-link>
OpenPAI Environment: ubuntun 16.04
OpenPAI version: 0.12.0
**services-configuration.yaml <denchmark-code>cluster: #common: # cluster-id: pai-example # # # HDFS, zookeeper data path on your cluster machine. # data-path: "/datastorage"
# the docker registry to store docker images that contain system services like frameworklauncher, hadoop, etc. docker-registry:
# The namespace in your registry. If the registry is docker.io, the namespace will be your user account. namespace: openpai
# E.g., gcr.io. # if the registry is hub.docker, please fill this value with docker.io domain: harbor.bglab.com/library # If the docker registry doesn't require authentication, please comment username and password username: admin password: Harbor12345
tag: v0.12.0
# The name of the secret in kubernetes will be created in your cluster # Must be lower case, e.g., regsecret. secret-name: pai-secret </denchmark-code>
** job task file <denchmark-code>{ "jobName": "tensorflow-cifar10", "image": "harbor.bglab.com/library/tensorflow/tensorflow:1.12.0-gpu-py3", "taskRoles": [ { "name": "default", "taskNumber": 1, "cpuNumber": 4, "memoryMB": 8192, "gpuNumber": 1, "command": "apt update && apt install -y git && git clone https://github.com/tensorflow/models && cd models/research/slim && python download_and_convert_data.py --dataset_name=cifar10 --dataset_dir=/tmp/data && python train_image_classifier.py --dataset_name=cifar10 --dataset_dir=/tmp/data --max_number_of_steps=1000" } ] } </denchmark-code>
** Exception Info <denchmark-code>2019-07-16 08:48:33,004 INFO [pool-1-thread-1] com.microsoft.frameworklauncher.service.StatusManager: Transitioned Framework [admin~tensorflow-cifar10-8_16bf9f47] comments.comment: Please change docker-registry.domain to docker.io in your service-configuration.yaml, it's docker registry for PAI services, instead of your job. Then update config and restart services. You only need to specify private registry in your job config file.
Why PAI services can not use private registry? I successed to start services with private registry .
PAI services can use private registry. Do you have harbor.bglab.com/library/openpai/hadoop-run:v0.12.0 image in your private registry?

I assume the image exists because you succeed to start service pods, then k8s works fine with your registry. It might be a Docker container issue in Hadoop YARN. /cc <denchmark-link:https://github.com/mzmssg>@mzmssg</denchmark-link>

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/lanya16>@lanya16</denchmark-link>
It's a hadoop bug, as a workaround, could you remove endpoint in domain, eg: <denchmark-code> namespace: openpai domain: harbor.bglab.com </denchmark-code>

@lanya16 It's a hadoop bug, as a workaround, could you remove entrypoint in domain, eg: namespace: openpai domain: harbor.bglab.com
Hadoop YARN checked your image format using <denchmark-link:https://github.com/apache/hadoop/blob/release-2.9.0-RC3/hadoop-yarn-project/hadoop-yarn/hadoop-yarn-server/hadoop-yarn-server-nodemanager/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/yarn/server/nodemanager/DockerContainerExecutor.java#L95-L101>a regex</denchmark-link> before running it, it only allows one ...
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/mzmssg>@mzmssg</denchmark-link> , any follow-up required? If not, please close the issue.
Need to fix in this release
